snippet.textDisplay: Finished #4 a few weeks back (no spoilers): WHAT A GAME!!!!!!

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly, the 1st Uncharted is by far the best. It has shooting portions, but it's mostly about the exploring which is what the 2nd and 3rd games lose a bit of. They're just all out shooters with tiny bits of walking in between.
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly, the 1st Uncharted is by far the best. It has shooting portions, but it's mostly about the exploring which is what the 2nd and 3rd games lose a bit of. They're just all out shooters with tiny bits of walking in between.

snippet.textDisplay: I can only imagine how difficult it is to create an epic, iconic theme for a franchise. The composer of this masterpiece is brilliant because the music captures the essence of Drake's adventures perfectly.
snippet.textOriginal: I can only imagine how difficult it is to create an epic, iconic theme for a franchise. The composer of this masterpiece is brilliant because the music captures the essence of Drake's adventures perfectly.

NAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAATE!!!!
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I respect your opinion but I strongly disagree. I hated Heavy Rain, with it's meh script, massive plot holes and game breaking controls, Uncharted is a much better representation of the PS3. And the second one was even better

snippet.textDisplay: Why does everyone say the enemies are hard? I found this game to be pretty easy. It's not a run n' gun like Gears of War. You have to use your cover and wait for the enemies to present themselves to you.
snippet.textOriginal: Why does everyone say the enemies are hard? I found this game to be pretty easy. It's not a run n' gun like Gears of War. You have to use your cover and wait for the enemies to present themselves to you.

snippet.textDisplay: Fuck yeah Uncharted! Everyone goes on about the train sequence in 2, but my favorite will always be the ship sequence in 3.

snippet.textDisplay: I've bought my PS3 just some 6 months ago, and I've really enjoyed games like Heavy Rain and Journey. I love the Yakuza series for the story and side-missions and from the recent games Ni No Kuni is a absolute must buy.

snippet.textDisplay: I whole-heartily recommend Heavy Rain, one of the more unique games this gen with a great really score!

snippet.textDisplay: Really good games for the PS3. If I had to recommend any 2 PS3 exclusive series, it would be the infamous games and, of course, the uncharted games.
snippet.textOriginal: Really good games for the PS3. If I had to recommend any 2 PS3 exclusive series, it would be the infamous games and, of course, the uncharted games.

snippet.textDisplay: I'd have to agree with you on the annoying firefights, but I still have a soft-spot for U1. I felt that 2, and especially 3, got a little bit over-the-top in the situations Drake got thrown into, although that's just me.  Plus, those frog-people are freaky as heck.
snippet.textOriginal: I'd have to agree with you on the annoying firefights, but I still have a soft-spot for U1. I felt that 2, and especially 3, got a little bit over-the-top in the situations Drake got thrown into, although that's just me.  Plus, those frog-people are freaky as heck.

snippet.textDisplay: I love the series, and the music is just as epic as the gameplay.

snippet.textDisplay: Overrated series in my opinion. It annoys me when developers focus on making the game cinematic at the expense of gameplay and level design. They were still pretty fun though, especially 2.
snippet.textOriginal: Overrated series in my opinion. It annoys me when developers focus on making the game cinematic at the expense of gameplay and level design. They were still pretty fun though, especially 2.

snippet.textDisplay: I've only played U3, but by golly it rocked! The campaign was so polished, and the Co-Op modes keep me coming back for more :)
snippet.textOriginal: I've only played U3, but by golly it rocked! The campaign was so polished, and the Co-Op modes keep me coming back for more :)

snippet.textDisplay: 3rd one was the best.
snippet.textOriginal: 3rd one was the best.

snippet.textDisplay:
IMHO the 2nd one is the best one
Better graphics, better story line, better combat, better puzzles, better overall experience, I still hate the heavy armor shotgun guys.
The third made me feel like they wanted to show us too much and didn't spend enough time on what really matters.
snippet.textOriginal:
IMHO the 2nd one is the best one
Better graphics, better story line, better combat, better puzzles, better overall experience, I still hate the heavy armor shotgun guys.
The third made me feel like they wanted to show us too much and didn't spend enough time on what really matters.

snippet.textDisplay: uncharted 2 and 3 are really amazing experiences nobody should miss, same goes for the witcher 2
snippet.textOriginal: uncharted 2 and 3 are really amazing experiences nobody should miss, same goes for the witcher 2

snippet.textDisplay: First game I completed on my PS3 last week. I thought it was pretty good, except for the often frustrating battle sequences. Waaaay too many of them and everytime, way too many enemies thrown at you that are all bullet sponges unless you pull headshots. The audiovisual experience was top notch though and I loved the setting. I'll be looking forward to playing Uncharted 2 seeing at it's been so well received.
snippet.textOriginal: First game I completed on my PS3 last week. I thought it was pretty good, except for the often frustrating battle sequences. Waaaay too many of them and everytime, way too many enemies thrown at you that are all bullet sponges unless you pull headshots. The audiovisual experience was top notch though and I loved the setting. I'll be looking forward to playing Uncharted 2 seeing at it's been so well received.
